Kim Yong Nam Meets Cuban Ambassador 
    Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and conversed with Cuban Ambassador to the DPRK Esteban Lobaina Romero who paid a farewell call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 On hand were Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and staff members of the Cuban embassy.

Gift to Kim Jong Il from Shanghai Juvenile Art Troupe
    Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a gift from the Shanghai juvenile art troupe of China on a visit to the DPRK.
 The gift was conveyed to an official concerned by Zou Wei, deputy general secretary of the Chinese Welfare Society who is heading the delegation.

DPRK Order�@Awarded to Cuban Ambassador
    Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- A ceremony for awarding DPRK order to the Cuban ambassador e. p. to the DPRK was held at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.
 After a decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly was read out, President Kim Yong Nam awarded DPRK Friendship Order First Class to Cuban Ambassador e.p. to the DPRK Esteban Lobaina Romero for his positive activities to develop the friendly relations between the DPRK and Cuba and support the Korean people's efforts for building a great prosperous powerful nation with his boundless reverence for President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.

DPRK Degree of Honorary DM Awarded to German
    Pyongyang, September 29 (KCNA) -- The DPRK degree of honorary doctor of medicine was awarded to Karsten Vilmar, chairman of the German-DPRK Medical Association, with due ceremony at the People's Palace of Culture on Wednesday.
 A certificate and medal of the DPRK degree of honorary doctor of medicine were awarded to the chairman in recognition of the contribution he has made to the development of clinical science and technology of Korea by forming the association and conducting brisk exchange and cooperation in the field of health care.    
 Present at the awarding ceremony were Kwak Pom Gi, vice-premier of the DPRK Cabinet who is chairman of the DPRK State Commission for Conferring Degrees and Titles, Kang Chun Gum, secretary of the Commission, Choe Chang Sik, vice-minister of Public Health and chairman of the Central Committee of the Korean Medical Association, officials concerned and officials of the German embassy here.
